alert.note: Alert for Orange (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 09 at 5:20PM EDT until July 09 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Upton has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Orange County in southeastern New York... * Until 715 PM EDT. * At 520 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Middletown, Port Jervis, Walden, Goshen, Howells, Montgomery, Florida, Otisville, Huguenot, Unionville, Scotchtown, Mechanicstown, Westtown, Maybrook, Slate Hill, Pine Bush, Pine Island, Circleville, Bullville and New Hampton. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
